FuncDef:
The remote-attestation ssl trusted-ca load command loads an SSL trusted CA file.
The undo remote-attestation ssl trusted-ca load command deletes an SSL trusted CA file.
By default, no SSL trusted CA file is loaded.
CLIs: undo remote-attestation ssl trusted-ca load pem-ca <cafile>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SSL trusted CA file.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the remote attestation is configured, to load an SSL trusted CA file in the PEM format, run the remote-attestation ssl trusted-ca load pem-ca cafile command.
The SSL trusted CA file is used to verify the CA identity. A CA is an organization that issues digital certificates. A CA that is widely trusted in the world is called the root CA. The root CA can authorize the other CAs that are subordinate CAs. The CA identity is described in a trusted CA file. To secure communication, run the remote-attestation ssl trusted-ca load command to load an SSL trusted CA file.
